Adding and Subtracting Polynomial Functions

Just as polynomials can be added and subtracted, polynomial functions can also be added and subtracted.


For functions \(f(x)\) and \(g(x)\),

  • \((f + g)(x) = f(x) + g(x)\)
  • \((f - g)(x) = f(x) - g(x)\)

Let’s look at some examples.

For the functions \(f(x) = 3x^2-5x+7\) and \(g(x) = x^2-4x-3\), find:

  1. \((f+g)(x)\)
  2. \( (f+g)(3) \)
  3. \( (f-g)(x) \)
  4. \( (f-g)(-2) \)
  1. (\(f+g)(x)=f(x)+g(x)\)

Step 1
Substitute \(f(x)={\style{color:red}3}{\style{color:red}x}^{\style{color:red}2}\;{\style{color:red}-}\;{\style{color:red}5}{\style{color:red}x}\;{\style{color:red}+}\;{\style{color:red}7}\) and \(g(x)={\style{color:blue}x}^{\style{color:blue}2}\;{\style{color:blue}-}\;{\style{color:blue}4}{\style{color:blue}x}\;{\style{color:blue}-}\;{\style{color:blue}3}\).
\((f+g)(x)=({\style{color:red}3}{\style{color:red}x}^{\style{color:red}2}\;{\style{color:red}-}\;{\style{color:red}5}{\style{color:red}x}\;{\style{color:red}+}\;{\style{color:red}7}){\style{color:blue}(}{\style{color:blue}x}^{\style{color:blue}2}\;{\style{color:blue}-}\;{\style{color:blue}4}{\style{color:blue}x}\;{\style{color:blue}-}\;{\style{color:blue}3}{\style{color:blue})}\)

Step 2
Rewrite without the parentheses.
\((f+g)(x)+3x^2-5x+7+x^2-4x+7-3\)

Step 3
Put like terms together.
\((f+g)(x)=3x^2+x^2-5x-4x+7-3\)

Step 4
Combine like terms.
\((f+g)(x)=4x^2-9x+4\)

In part (a), we found \((f+g)(x)\), and now are asked to find \((f+g)(3)\).


  1. \((f+g)(x)=4x^2-9x+4\)

Step 1
To find \((f+g)(3)\), substitute \(x=3\).
\((f+g)(3)=4(3)^2-9 \cdot 3+4\)

Step 2
Simplify.
\((f+g)(3)=4 \cdot 9-9 \cdot 3+ 4\)
\((f+g)(3)=36-27+4\)
\((f+g)(3)=13\)

Notice that we could have found \((f+g)(3)\) by first finding the values of \(f(3)\) and \(g(3)\) separately and then adding the results.

Step 1
Find \(f (3)\).
\(f(x)=3x^2-5x+7\)
\( f({\style{color:red}3})=3({\style{color:red}3})^2-5({\style{color:red}3})+7\)
\(f(3)=19\)

Step 2
Find \(g(3)\).
\(g(x)=x^2-4x-3\)
\(g(3)=-6\)

Step 3
Find \((f+g)(3)\).
\((f+g)(x)=f(x)+g(x)\)
\((f+g)(3)=f(3)+g(3)\)

Step 4
Substitute \(f(3)={\style{color:red}1}{\style{color:red}9}\) and \(g(3)= {\style{color:blue}-}{\style{color:blue}6}\).
\((f+g)(3)=19+(-6)\)
\((f+g)(3)=13\)


  1. \((f-g)(x)=f(x)-g(x)\)

Step 1
Substitute \(f(x)={\style{color:red}3}{\style{color:red}x}^{\style{color:red}2}\;{\style{color:red}-}\;{\style{color:red}5}{\style{color:red}x}\;{\style{color:red}+}\;{\style{color:red}7}\) and \(g(x)= {\style{color:blue}x}^{\style{color:blue}2}\;{\style{color:blue}-}\;{\style{color:blue}4}{\style{color:blue}x}\;{\style{color:blue}-}\;{\style{color:blue}3}\).
\((f-g)(x)=( {\style{color:red}3}{\style{color:red}x}^{\style{color:red}2}\;{\style{color:red}-}\;{\style{color:red}5}{\style{color:red}x}\;{\style{color:red}+}\;{\style{color:red}7})-({\style{color:blue}x}^{\style{color:blue}2}\;{\style{color:blue}-}\;{\style{color:blue}4}{\style{color:blue}x}\;{\style{color:blue}-}\;{\style{color:blue}3})\)

Step 2
Rewrite without the parentheses.
\((f-g)(x)=3x^2-5x+7-x^2-4x-3\)

Step 3
Put like terms together.
\((f-g)(x)=3x^2-x^2-5x+4x+7+3\)

Step 4
Combine like terms.
\((f-g)(x)=2x^2-x+10\)


  1. \((f-g)(x)=2x^2-x+10\)

Step 1
To find \((f-g)(-2)\), substitute \(x={\style{color:red}-}{\style{color:red}2}\).
\((f-g)( {\style{color:red}-}{\style{color:red}2})=2({\style{color:red}-}{\style{color:red}2})^2-({\style{color:red}-}{\style{color:red}2})+10\)

Step 2
Simplify.
\((f-g)(-2)=2 \cdot 5-(-2)+10\)
\((f-g)(-2)=20\)


Try It: Adding and Subtracting Polynomial Functions


For functions \(f(x)=2x^2-4x+3\) and \(g(x)=x^2-2x-6\), find:

  1. \((f+g)(x)\)
  2. \((f+g)(3)\)
  3. \((f-g)(x)\)
  4. \((f-g)(-2)\)

Write down your answers. Then select the Solution button to compare your work.

Here is how to add and subtract the polynomial functions:

  1. \(\begin{array}{rcl}(f+g)(x)&=&(2x^2-4x+3)+(x^2-2x-6)\\&=&2x^2-4x+3+x^2-2x-6\\&=&3x^2-6x-3\end{array}\)

  2. \(\begin{array}{rcl}(f+g)(3)&=&3(3)^2-6(3)-3\\&=&3(3)^2-6(3)-3\\&=&3(9)-18-3\\&=&6\end{array}\)

  3. \(\begin{array}{rcl}(f-g)(x)&=&(2x^2-4x+3)-(x^2-2x-6)\\&=&2x^2-4x+3-x^2+2x+6\\&=&x^2-2x+9\;\end{array}\)

  4. \(\begin{array}{rcl}(f-g)(-2)&=&(-2)^2-2(-2)+9\;\\&=&(4)+4+9\;\\&=&17\;\end{array}\)
